label: Behavior 26673352
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: following a curved maritime route (the persistent small differences between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and gradual course evolution, suggest the vessel is navigating a predefined curved channel or coastal bend; position progression follows an approximately linear trajectory in geographic coordinates with slight northeasterly curvature, modeled by a second-order polynomial: latitude ≈ 55.057 + 0.00047 × t, longitude ≈ 7.3779 - 0.000023 × t + 0.00000015 × t², where t is sequential time index)

Course change: gradual and consistent (COG varies slowly between 354.3° and 359.1°, indicating a smooth, continuous adjustment in direction over time)
Heading fluctuation: stable (heading remains nearly constant at 2.0°–4.0°, suggesting precise rudder control and no abrupt turns)

Behavior intent: following a curved maritime route (the persistent small differences between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and gradual course evolution, suggest the vessel is navigating a predefined curved channel or coastal bend; position progression follows an approximately linear trajectory in geographic coordinates with slight northeasterly curvature, modeled by a second-order polynomial: latitude ≈ 55.057 + 0.00047 × t, longitude ≈ 7.3779 - 0.000023 × t + 0.00000015 × t², where t is sequential time index)
